definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to get rid of/to remove/to exclude/to eliminate/to wipe out/to divide/except/not including
book or record/registry/roll/place of one's family or ancestral records/membership

sentences.english: Expelled from the party the same day the party was also Second Vice card Charlie.
sentences.chinese: 同日被开除党籍的还有该党第二副主席卡查利。

sentences.english: Mr. Chen, who has been expelled from the Communist Party, has yet to go on trial for the charges against him.
sentences.chinese: 陈良玉已被开除党籍，但还没有正式定罪服刑。

sentences.english: Expulsion is the ultimate Party disciplinary measure.
sentences.chinese: 开除党籍是党内的最高处分。

definition: to discipline sb/to punish/disciplinary action/to deal with (a matter)/CL:個|个[ge4]
lack of discipline/to break a rule/to violate discipline/to breach a principle
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to file for investigation/to prosecute (a case)
shuanggui, an extralegal system within the CCP for detaining and interrogating cadres who fall from grace
Central Commission for Discipline Inspection of the CCP
